summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 15858 entitled "An Ordinance authorizing the Board of Park Commissioners of the City of Seattle to acquire by private purchase or by condemnation Tracts 125, 126, 127, 137, 138 and 139, replat of John J. McGilvra's Addition to the City of Seattle, which replat is also a replat of Blocks 13, 14, 18 to 29, inclusive and the south half of 19, of John J. McGilvra's Second Addition to the City of Seattle, and selecting Washington Boulevard from the southerly line of Madison Street to the southerly line of East Harrison Street and East Harrison Street from the westerly lien of Washington Boulevard to the easterly side of Hillside Drive and Hillside Drive from the northerly line of East Harrison Street to McGilvra Boulevard, for park drives, parkways and boulevards, and authorizing the condemnation of said streets as may be required by law for the ascertainment and payment to the proper parties of the damage, if any, which will result to the property to be affected thereby," passed by the City Council and signed by the President of the City Council on the 22nd day of April, 1907, and approved by the Mayor of the City of Seattle on the 25th day of April, 1907.
